013package org.apache.juneau.rest.client;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ThrowableUtils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.IOUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.internal.StringUtils.*;
018
019import java.io.*;
020import java.lang.reflect.*;
021import java.nio.charset.*;
022import java.util.concurrent.*;
023import java.util.regex.*;
024import java.util.regex.Matcher;
025
026import org.apache.http.*;
027import org.apache.http.conn.*;
028import org.apache.juneau.*;
029import org.apache.juneau.assertions.*;
030import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
031import org.apache.juneau.http.entity.*;
032import org.apache.juneau.http.resource.*;
033import org.apache.juneau.httppart.*;
034import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
035import org.apache.juneau.oapi.*;
036import org.apache.juneau.objecttools.*;
037import org.apache.juneau.parser.*;
038import org.apache.juneau.parser.ParseException;
039import org.apache.juneau.reflect.*;
040import org.apache.juneau.rest.client.assertion.*;
041
042/**
043 * Represents the body of an HTTP response.
044 *
045 * <p>
046 * An extension of an HttpClient {@link HttpEntity} that provides various support for converting the body to POJOs and
047 * other convenience methods.
048 *
049 * <ul class='seealso'>
050 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-rest-client">juneau-rest-client</a>
051 * </ul>
052 */
053public class ResponseContent implements HttpEntity {
054
055   private static final HttpEntity NULL_ENTITY = new HttpEntity() {
056
057      @Override
058      public boolean isRepeatable() {
059         return false;
060      }
061
062      @Override
063      public boolean isChunked() {
064         return false;
065      }
066
067      @Override
068      public long getContentLength() {
069         return -1;
070      }
071
072      @Override
073      public Header getContentType() {
074         return ResponseHeader.NULL_HEADER;
075      }
076
077      @Override
078      public Header getContentEncoding() {
079         return ResponseHeader.NULL_HEADER;
080      }
081
082      @Override
083      public InputStream getContent() throws IOException, UnsupportedOperationException {
084         return new ByteArrayInputStream(new byte[0]);
085      }
086
087      @Override
088      public void writeTo(OutputStream outstream) throws IOException {}
089
090      @Override
091      public boolean isStreaming() {
092         return false;
093      }
094
095      @Override
096      public void consumeContent() throws IOException {}
097   };
098
099   private final RestClient client;
100   final RestRequest request;
101   final RestResponse response;
102   private final HttpEntity entity;
103   private HttpPartSchema schema;
104   private Parser parser;
105   private byte[] body;
106   private boolean cached;
107   boolean isConsumed;
108
109   /**
110    * Constructor.
111    *
112    * @param client The client used to build this request.
113    * @param request The request object.
114    * @param response The response object.
115    * @param parser The parser to use to consume the body.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
116    */
117   public ResponseContent(RestClient client, RestRequest request, RestResponse response, Parser parser) {
118      this.client = client;
119      this.request = request;
120      this.response = response;
121      this.parser = parser;
122      this.entity = ObjectUtils.firstNonNull(response.asHttpResponse().getEntity(), NULL_ENTITY);
123   }
124
125   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
126   // Setters
127   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
128
129   /**
130    * Specifies the parser to use for this body.
131    *
132    * <p>
133    * If not specified, uses the parser defined on the client set via {@link RestClient.Builder#parser(Class)}.
134    *
135    * @param value
136    *    The new part parser to use for this body.
137    * @return This object.
138    */
139   public ResponseContent parser(Parser value) {
140      this.parser = value;
141      return this;
142   }
143
144   /**
145    * Specifies the schema for this body.
146    *
147    * <p>
148    * Used by schema-based parsers such as {@link OpenApiParser}.
149    *
150    * @param value The schema.
151    * @return This object.
152    */
153   public ResponseContent schema(HttpPartSchema value) {
154      this.schema = value;
155      return this;
156   }
157
158   /**
159    * Causes the contents of the response body to be stored so that it can be repeatedly read.
160    *
161    * <p>
162    * Calling this method allows methods that read the response body to be called multiple times.
163    *
164    * <ul class='notes'>
165    *    <li class='note'>
166    *       Multiple calls to this method are ignored.
167    * </ul>
168    *
169    * @return This object.
170    */
171   public ResponseContent cache() {
172      this.cached = true;
173      return this;
174   }
175
176   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
177   // Raw streams
178   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
179
180   /**
181    * Returns the HTTP response message body as an input stream.
182    *
183    * <ul class='notes'>
184    *    <li class='note'>
185    *       Once this input stream is exhausted, it will automatically be closed.
186    *  <li class='note'>
187    *    This method can be called multiple times if {@link #cache()} has been called.
188    *  <li class='note'>
189    *    Calling this method multiple times without caching enabled will cause a {@link RestCallException}
190    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} to be thrown.
191    * </ul>
192    *
193    * @return
194    *    The HTTP response message body input stream, never <jk>null</jk>.
195    *    <br>For responses without a body(e.g. HTTP 204), returns an empty stream.
196    * @throws IOException If a stream or illegal state exception was thrown.
197    */
198   @SuppressWarnings("resource")
199   public InputStream asInputStream() throws IOException {
200      try {
201         if (body != null)
202            return new ByteArrayInputStream(body);
203
204         if (cached) {
205            body = readBytes(entity.getContent());
206            response.close();
207            return new ByteArrayInputStream(body);
208         }
209
210         if (isConsumed && ! entity.isRepeatable())
211            throw new IllegalStateException("Method cannot be called.  Response has already been consumed.  Consider using the RestResponse.cacheBody() method.");
212
213         HttpEntity e = response.asHttpResponse().getEntity();
214         InputStream is = e == null ? new ByteArrayInputStream(new byte[0]) : e.getContent();
215
216         is = new EofSensorInputStream(is, new EofSensorWatcher() {
217            @Override
218            public boolean eofDetected(InputStream wrapped) throws IOException {
219               try {
220                  response.close();
221               } catch (RestCallException e) {}
222               return true;
223            }
224            @Override
225            public boolean streamClosed(InputStream wrapped) throws IOException {
226               try {
227                  response.close();
228               } catch (RestCallException e) {}
229               return true;
230            }
231            @Override
232            public boolean streamAbort(InputStream wrapped) throws IOException {
233               try {
234                  response.close();
235               } catch (RestCallException e) {}
236               return true;
237            }
238         });
239
240         isConsumed = true;
241
242         return is;
243      } catch (UnsupportedOperationException | RestCallException e) {
244         throw new IOException(e);
245      }
246   }
247
248   /**
249    * Returns the HTTP response message body as a reader based on the charset on the <code>Content-Type</code> response header.
250    *
251    * <ul class='notes'>
252    *    <li class='note'>
253    *       If no charset was found on the <code>Content-Type</code> response header, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is assumed.
254    *    <li class='note'>
255    *       Once this input stream is exhausted, it will automatically be closed.
256    *  <li class='note'>
257    *    This method can be called multiple times if {@link #cache()} has been called.
258    *  <li class='note'>
259    *    Calling this method multiple times without caching enabled will cause a {@link RestCallException}
260    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} to be thrown.
261    * </ul>
262    *
263    * @return
264    *    The HTTP response message body reader, never <jk>null</jk>.
265    *    <br>For responses without a body(e.g. HTTP 204), returns an empty reader.
266    * @throws IOException If an exception occurred.
267    */
268   public Reader asReader() throws IOException {
269
270      // Figure out what the charset of the response is.
271      String cs = null;
272      String ct = getContentType().orElse(null);
273
274      // First look for "charset=" in Content-Type header of response.
275      if (ct != null)
276         if (ct.contains("charset="))
277            cs = ct.substring(ct.indexOf("charset=")+8).trim();
278
279      return asReader(cs == null ? IOUtils.UTF8 : Charset.forName(cs));
280   }
281
282   /**
283    * Returns the HTTP response message body as a reader using the specified charset.
284    *
285    * <ul class='notes'>
286    *    <li class='note'>
287    *       Once this input stream is exhausted, it will automatically be closed.
288    *  <li class='note'>
289    *    This method can be called multiple times if {@link #cache()} has been called.
290    *  <li class='note'>
291    *    Calling this method multiple times without caching enabled will cause a {@link RestCallException}
292    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} to be thrown.
293    * </ul>
294    *
295    * @param charset
296    *    The charset to use for the reader.
297    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is used.
298    * @return
299    *    The HTTP response message body reader, never <jk>null</jk>.
300    *    <br>For responses without a body(e.g. HTTP 204), returns an empty reader.
301    * @throws IOException If an exception occurred.
302    */
303   public Reader asReader(Charset charset) throws IOException {
304      return new InputStreamReader(asInputStream(), charset == null ? IOUtils.UTF8 : charset);
305   }
306
307   /**
308    * Returns the HTTP response message body as a byte array.
309    *
310    *    The HTTP response message body reader, never <jk>null</jk>.
311    *    <br>For responses without a body(e.g. HTTP 204), returns an empty array.
312    *
313    * @return The HTTP response body as a byte array.
314    * @throws RestCallException If an exception occurred.
315    */
316   public byte[] asBytes() throws RestCallException {
317      if (body == null) {
318         try {
319            if (entity instanceof BasicHttpEntity) {
320               body = ((BasicHttpEntity)entity).asBytes();
321            } else {
322               body = readBytes(entity.getContent());
323            }
324         } catch (IOException e) {
325            throw new RestCallException(response, e, "Could not read response body.");
326         } finally {
327            response.close();
328         }
329      }
330      return body;
331   }
332
333
334   /**
335    * Pipes the contents of the response to the specified output stream.
336    *
337    * <ul class='notes'>
338    * <li class='note'>
339    *    The output stream is not automatically closed.
340    *    <li class='note'>
341    *       Once the input stream is exhausted, it will automatically be closed.
342    *  <li class='note'>
343    *    This method can be called multiple times if {@link #cache()} has been called.
344    *  <li class='note'>
345    *    Calling this method multiple times without caching enabled will cause a {@link RestCallException}
346    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} to be thrown.
347    * </ul>
348    *
349    * @param os The output stream to pipe the output to.
350    * @return This object.
351    * @throws IOException If an IO exception occurred.
352    */
353   public RestResponse pipeTo(OutputStream os) throws IOException {
354      pipe(asInputStream(), os);
355      return response;
356   }
357
358   /**
359    * Pipes the contents of the response to the specified writer.
360    *
361    * <ul class='notes'>
362    * <li class='note'>
363    *    The writer is not automatically closed.
364    *    <li class='note'>
365    *       Once the reader is exhausted, it will automatically be closed.
366    *    <li class='note'>
367    *       If no charset was found on the <code>Content-Type</code> response header, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is assumed.
368    *  <li class='note'>
369    *    This method can be called multiple times if {@link #cache()} has been called.
370    *  <li class='note'>
371    *    Calling this method multiple times without caching enabled will cause a {@link RestCallException}
372    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} to be thrown.
373    * </ul>
374    *
375    * @param w The writer to pipe the output to.
376    * @return This object.
377    * @throws IOException If an IO exception occurred.
378    */
379   public RestResponse pipeTo(Writer w) throws IOException {
380      return pipeTo(w, false);
381   }
382
383   /**
384    * Pipes the contents of the response to the specified writer.
385    *
386    * <ul class='notes'>
387    * <li class='note'>
388    *    The writer is not automatically closed.
389    *    <li class='note'>
390    *       Once the reader is exhausted, it will automatically be closed.
391    *  <li class='note'>
392    *    This method can be called multiple times if {@link #cache()} has been called.
393    *  <li class='note'>
394    *    Calling this method multiple times without caching enabled will cause a {@link RestCallException}
395    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} to be thrown.
396    * </ul>
397    *
398    * @param w The writer to pipe the output to.
399    * @param charset
400    *    The charset to use for the reader.
401    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is used.
402    * @return This object.
403    * @throws IOException If an IO exception occurred.
404    */
405   public RestResponse pipeTo(Writer w, Charset charset) throws IOException {
406      return pipeTo(w, charset, false);
407   }
408
409   /**
410    * Pipes the contents of the response to the specified writer.
411    *
412    * <ul class='notes'>
413    * <li class='note'>
414    *    The writer is not automatically closed.
415    *    <li class='note'>
416    *       Once the reader is exhausted, it will automatically be closed.
417    *    <li class='note'>
418    *       If no charset was found on the <code>Content-Type</code> response header, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is assumed.
419    *  <li class='note'>
420    *    This method can be called multiple times if {@link #cache()} has been called.
421    *  <li class='note'>
422    *    Calling this method multiple times without caching enabled will cause a {@link RestCallException}
423    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} to be thrown.
424    * </ul>
425    *
426    * @param w The writer to write the output to.
427    * @param byLines Flush the writers after every line of output.
428    * @return This object.
429    * @throws IOException If an IO exception occurred.
430    */
431   public RestResponse pipeTo(Writer w, boolean byLines) throws IOException {
432      return pipeTo(w, null, byLines);
433   }
434
435   /**
436    * Pipes the contents of the response to the specified writer.
437    *
438    * <ul class='notes'>
439    * <li class='note'>
440    *    The writer is not automatically closed.
441    *    <li class='note'>
442    *       Once the reader is exhausted, it will automatically be closed.
443    *  <li class='note'>
444    *    This method can be called multiple times if {@link #cache()} has been called.
445    *  <li class='note'>
446    *    Calling this method multiple times without caching enabled will cause a {@link RestCallException}
447    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} to be thrown.
448    * </ul>
449    *
450    * @param w The writer to pipe the output to.
451    * @param byLines Flush the writers after every line of output.
452    * @param charset
453    *    The charset to use for the reader.
454    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is used.
455    * @return This object.
456    * @throws IOException If an IO exception occurred.
457    */
458   public RestResponse pipeTo(Writer w, Charset charset, boolean byLines) throws IOException {
459      if (byLines)
460         pipeLines(asReader(charset), w);
461      else
462         pipe(asReader(charset), w);
463      return response;
464   }
465
466   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
467   // Retrievers
468   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
469
470   /**
471    * Parses HTTP body into the specified object type.
472    *
473    * <p>
474    * The type can be a simple type (e.g. beans, strings, numbers) or parameterized type (collections/maps).
475    *
476    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
477    * <p class='bjava'>
478    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of strings.</jc>
479    *    List&lt;String&gt; <jv>list1</jv> = <jv>client</jv>
480    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
481    *       .run()
482    *       .getContent().as(LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
483    *
484    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of beans.</jc>
485    *    List&lt;MyBean&gt; <jv>list2</jv> = <jv>client</jv>
486    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
487    *       .run()
488    *       .getContent().as(LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
489    *
490    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of linked-lists of strings.</jc>
491    *    List&lt;List&lt;String&gt;&gt; <jv>list3</jv> = <jv>client</jv>
492    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
493    *       .run()
494    *       .getContent().as(LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
495    *
496    *    <jc>// Parse into a map of string keys/values.</jc>
497    *    Map&lt;String,String&gt; <jv>map1</jv> = <jv>client</jv>
498    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
499    *       .run()
500    *       .getContent().as(TreeMap.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
501    *
502    *    <jc>// Parse into a map containing string keys and values of lists containing beans.</jc>
503    *    Map&lt;String,List&lt;MyBean&gt;&gt; <jv>map2</jv> = <jv>client</jv>
504    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
505    *       .run()
506    *       .getContent().as(TreeMap.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>, List.<jk>class</jk>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
507    * </p>
508    *
509    * <p>
510    * <c>Collection</c> classes are assumed to be followed by zero or one objects indicating the element type.
511    *
512    * <p>
513    * <c>Map</c> classes are assumed to be followed by zero or two meta objects indicating the key and value types.
514    *
515    * <p>
516    * The array can be arbitrarily long to indicate arbitrarily complex data structures.
517    *
518    * <ul class='notes'>
519    *    <li class='note'>
520    *       Use the {@link #as(Class)} method instead if you don't need a parameterized map/collection.
521    *    <li class='note'>
522    *       You can also specify any of the following types:
523    *       <ul class='compact'>
524    *          <li>{@link ResponseContent}/{@link HttpEntity} - Returns access to this object.
525    *          <li>{@link Reader} - Returns access to the raw reader of the response.
526    *          <li>{@link InputStream} - Returns access to the raw input stream of the response.
527    *          <li>{@link HttpResource} - Response will be converted to an {@link BasicResource}.
528    *          <li>Any type that takes in an {@link HttpResponse} object.
529    *       </ul>
530    *    <li class='note'>
531    *    If {@link #cache()} or {@link RestResponse#cacheContent()} has been called, this method can be can be called multiple times and/or combined with
532    *    other methods that retrieve the content of the response.  Otherwise a {@link RestCallException}
533    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} will be thrown.
534    *    <li class='note'>
535    *       The input stream is automatically closed after this call.
536    * </ul>
537    *
538    * @param <T> The class type of the object to create.
539    * @param type
540    *    The object type to create.
541    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
542    * @param args
543    *    The type arguments of the class if it's a collection or map.
544    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
545    *    <br>Ignored if the main type is not a map or collection.
546    * @return The parsed object.
547    * @throws RestCallException
548    *    <ul>
549    *       <li>If the input contains a syntax error or is malformed, or is not valid for the specified type.
550    *       <li>If a connection error occurred.
551    *    </ul>
552    * @see BeanSession#getClassMeta(Class) for argument syntax for maps and collections.
553    */
554   public <T> T as(Type type, Type...args) throws RestCallException {
555      return as(getClassMeta(type, args));
556   }
557
558   /**
559    * Same as {@link #as(Type,Type...)} except optimized for a non-parameterized class.
560    *
561    * <p>
562    * This is the preferred parse method for simple types since you don't need to cast the results.
563    *
564    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
565    * <p class='bjava'>
566    *    <jc>// Parse into a string.</jc>
567    *    String <jv>string</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).run().getContent().as(String.<jk>class</jk>);
568    *
569    *    <jc>// Parse into a bean.</jc>
570    *    MyBean <jv>bean</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).run().getContent().as(MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
571    *
572    *    <jc>// Parse into a bean array.</jc>
573    *    MyBean[] <jv>beanArray</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).run().getContent().as(MyBean[].<jk>class</jk>);
574    *
575    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of objects.</jc>
576    *    List <jv>list</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).run().getContent().as(LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>);
577    *
578    *    <jc>// Parse into a map of object keys/values.</jc>
579    *    Map <jv>map</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).run().getContent().as(TreeMap.<jk>class</jk>);
580    * </p>
581    *
582    * <ul class='notes'>
583    *    <li class='note'>
584    *       You can also specify any of the following types:
585    *       <ul class='compact'>
586    *          <li>{@link ResponseContent}/{@link HttpEntity} - Returns access to this object.
587    *          <li>{@link Reader} - Returns access to the raw reader of the response.
588    *          <li>{@link InputStream} - Returns access to the raw input stream of the response.
589    *          <li>{@link HttpResource} - Response will be converted to an {@link BasicResource}.
590    *          <li>Any type that takes in an {@link HttpResponse} object.
591    *       </ul>
592    *    <li class='note'>
593    *    If {@link #cache()} or {@link RestResponse#cacheContent()} has been called, this method can be can be called multiple times and/or combined with
594    *    other methods that retrieve the content of the response.  Otherwise a {@link RestCallException}
595    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} will be thrown.
596    *    <li class='note'>
597    *       The input stream is automatically closed after this call.
598    * </ul>
599    *
600    * @param <T>
601    *    The class type of the object being created.
602    *    See {@link #as(Type,Type...)} for details.
603    * @param type The object type to create.
604    * @return The parsed object.
605    * @throws RestCallException
606    *    If the input contains a syntax error or is malformed, or is not valid for the specified type, or if a connection
607    *    error occurred.
608    */
609   public <T> T as(Class<T> type) throws RestCallException {
610      return as(getClassMeta(type));
611   }
612
613   /**
614    * Same as {@link #as(Class)} except allows you to predefine complex data types using the {@link ClassMeta} API.
615    *
616    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
617    * <p class='bjava'>
618    *    BeanContext <jv>beanContext</jv> = BeanContext.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>;
619    *
620    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of strings.</jc>
621    * ClassMeta&lt;List&lt;String&gt;&gt; <jv>cm1</jv> = <jv>beanContext</jv>.getClassMeta(LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
622    *    List&lt;String&gt; <jv>list1</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).run().getContent().as(<jv>cm1</jv>);
623    *
624    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of beans.</jc>
625    * ClassMeta&lt;List&lt;String&gt;&gt; <jv>cm2</jv> = <jv>beanContext</jv>.getClassMeta(LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
626    *    List&lt;MyBean&gt; <jv>list2</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).run().getContent().as(<jv>cm2</jv>);
627    *
628    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of linked-lists of strings.</jc>
629    * ClassMeta&lt;List&lt;String&gt;&gt; <jv>cm3</jv> = <jv>beanContext</jv>.getClassMeta(LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
630    *    List&lt;List&lt;String&gt;&gt; <jv>list3</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).run().getContent().as(<jv>cm3</jv>);
631    *
632    *    <jc>// Parse into a map of string keys/values.</jc>
633    * ClassMeta&lt;List&lt;String&gt;&gt; <jv>cm4</jv> = <jv>beanContext</jv>.getClassMeta(TreeMap.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
634    *    Map&lt;String,String&gt; <jv>map4</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).run().getContent().as(<jv>cm4</jv>);
635    *
636    *    <jc>// Parse into a map containing string keys and values of lists containing beans.</jc>
637    * ClassMeta&lt;List&lt;String&gt;&gt; <jv>cm5</jv> = <jv>beanContext</jv>.getClassMeta(TreeMap.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>, List.<jk>class</jk>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
638    *    Map&lt;String,List&lt;MyBean&gt;&gt; <jv>map5</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).run().getContent().as(<jv>cm5</jv>);
639    * </p>
640    *
641    * <ul class='notes'>
642    *    <li class='note'>
643    *    If {@link #cache()} or {@link RestResponse#cacheContent()} has been called, this method can be can be called multiple times and/or combined with
644    *    other methods that retrieve the content of the response.  Otherwise a {@link RestCallException}
645    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} will be thrown.
646    *    <li class='note'>
647    *       The input stream is automatically closed after this call.
648    * </ul>
649    *
650    * @param <T> The class type of the object to create.
651    * @param type The object type to create.
652    * @return The parsed object.
653    * @throws RestCallException
654    *    <ul>
655    *       <li>If the input contains a syntax error or is malformed, or is not valid for the specified type.
656    *       <li>If a connection error occurred.
657    *    </ul>
658    * @see BeanSession#getClassMeta(Class) for argument syntax for maps and collections.
659    */
660   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
661   public <T> T as(ClassMeta<T> type) throws RestCallException {
662      try {
663         if (type.is(ResponseContent.class) || type.is(HttpEntity.class))
664            return (T)this;
665
666         if (type.is(Reader.class))
667            return (T)asReader();
668
669         if (type.is(InputStream.class))
670            return (T)asInputStream();
671
672         if (type.is(HttpResponse.class))
673            return (T)response;
674
675         if (type.is(HttpResource.class))
676            type = (ClassMeta<T>)getClassMeta(BasicResource.class);
677
678         ConstructorInfo ci = type.getInfo().getPublicConstructor(x -> x.hasParamTypes(HttpResponse.class));
679         if (ci != null) {
680            try {
681               return (T)ci.invoke(response);
682            } catch (ExecutableException e) {
683               throw asRuntimeException(e);
684            }
685         }
686
687         String ct = firstNonEmpty(response.getHeader("Content-Type").orElse("text/plain"));
688
689         if (parser == null)
690            parser = client.getMatchingParser(ct);
691
692         MediaType mt = MediaType.of(ct);
693
694         if (parser == null || (mt.toString().contains("text/plain") && ! parser.canHandle(ct))) {
695            if (type.hasStringMutater())
696               return type.getStringMutater().mutate(asString());
697         }
698
699         if (parser != null) {
700            try (Closeable in = parser.isReaderParser() ? asReader() : asInputStream()) {
701
702               T t = parser
703                  .createSession()
704                  .properties(JsonMap.create().inner(request.getSessionProperties()))
705                  .locale(response.getLocale())
706                  .mediaType(mt)
707                  .schema(schema)
708                  .build()
709                  .parse(in, type);
710
711               // Some HTTP responses have no body, so try to create these beans if they've got no-arg constructors.
712               if (t == null && ! type.is(String.class)) {
713                  ConstructorInfo c = type.getInfo().getPublicConstructor(x -> x.hasNoParams());
714                  if (c != null) {
715                     try {
716                        return c.<T>invoke();
717                     } catch (ExecutableException e) {
718                        throw new ParseException(e);
719                     }
720                  }
721               }
722
723               return t;
724            }
725         }
726
727         if (type.hasReaderMutater())
728            return type.getReaderMutater().mutate(asReader());
729
730         if (type.hasInputStreamMutater())
731            return type.getInputStreamMutater().mutate(asInputStream());
732
733         ct = response.getStringHeader("Content-Type").orElse(null);
734
735         if (ct == null && client.hasParsers())
736            throw new ParseException("Content-Type not specified in response header.  Cannot find appropriate parser.");
737
738         throw new ParseException("Unsupported media-type in request header ''Content-Type'': ''{0}''", ct);
739
740      } catch (ParseException | IOException e) {
741         response.close();
742         throw new RestCallException(response, e, "Could not parse response body.");
743      }
744   }
745
746   /**
747    * Same as {@link #as(Class)} but allows you to run the call asynchronously.
748    *
749    * <ul class='notes'>
750    *    <li class='note'>
751    *    If {@link #cache()} or {@link RestResponse#cacheContent()} has been called, this method can be can be called multiple times and/or combined with
752    *    other methods that retrieve the content of the response.  Otherwise a {@link RestCallException}
753    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} will be thrown.
754    *    <li class='note'>
755    *       The input stream is automatically closed after the execution of the future.
756    * </ul>
757    *
758    * @param <T> The class type of the object being created.
759    * @param type The object type to create.
760    * @return The future object.
761    * @throws RestCallException If the executor service was not defined.
762    * @see
763    *    RestClient.Builder#executorService(ExecutorService, boolean) for defining the executor service for creating
764    *    {@link Future Futures}.
765    */
766   public <T> Future<T> asFuture(final Class<T> type) throws RestCallException {
767      return client.getExecutorService().submit(
768         new Callable<T>() {
769            @Override /* Callable */
770            public T call() throws Exception {
771               return as(type);
772            }
773         }
774      );
775   }
776
777   /**
778    * Same as {@link #as(ClassMeta)} but allows you to run the call asynchronously.
779    *
780    * <ul class='notes'>
781    *    <li class='note'>
782    *    If {@link #cache()} or {@link RestResponse#cacheContent()} has been called, this method can be can be called multiple times and/or combined with
783    *    other methods that retrieve the content of the response.  Otherwise a {@link RestCallException}
784    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} will be thrown.
785    *    <li class='note'>
786    *       The input stream is automatically closed after the execution of the future.
787    * </ul>
788    *
789    * @param <T>
790    *    The class type of the object being created.
791    *    See {@link #as(Type, Type...)} for details.
792    * @param type The object type to create.
793    * @return The future object.
794    * @throws RestCallException If the executor service was not defined.
795    * @see
796    *    RestClient.Builder#executorService(ExecutorService, boolean) for defining the executor service for creating
797    *    {@link Future Futures}.
798    */
799   public <T> Future<T> asFuture(final ClassMeta<T> type) throws RestCallException {
800      return client.getExecutorService().submit(
801         new Callable<T>() {
802            @Override /* Callable */
803            public T call() throws Exception {
804               return as(type);
805            }
806         }
807      );
808   }
809
810   /**
811    * Same as {@link #as(Type,Type...)} but allows you to run the call asynchronously.
812    *
813    * <ul class='notes'>
814    *    <li class='note'>
815    *    If {@link #cache()} or {@link RestResponse#cacheContent()} has been called, this method can be can be called multiple times and/or combined with
816    *    other methods that retrieve the content of the response.  Otherwise a {@link RestCallException}
817    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} will be thrown.
818    *    <li class='note'>
819    *       The input stream is automatically closed after the execution of the future.
820    * </ul>
821    *
822    * @param <T>
823    *    The class type of the object being created.
824    *    See {@link #as(Type, Type...)} for details.
825    * @param type
826    *    The object type to create.
827    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
828    * @param args
829    *    The type arguments of the class if it's a collection or map.
830    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
831    *    <br>Ignored if the main type is not a map or collection.
832    * @return The future object.
833    * @throws RestCallException If the executor service was not defined.
834    * @see
835    *    RestClient.Builder#executorService(ExecutorService, boolean) for defining the executor service for creating
836    *    {@link Future Futures}.
837    */
838   public <T> Future<T> asFuture(final Type type, final Type...args) throws RestCallException {
839      return client.getExecutorService().submit(
840         new Callable<T>() {
841            @Override /* Callable */
842            public T call() throws Exception {
843               return as(type, args);
844            }
845         }
846      );
847   }
848
849   /**
850    * Returns the contents of this body as a string.
851    *
852    * <ul class='notes'>
853    *    <li class='note'>
854    *       If no charset was found on the <code>Content-Type</code> response header, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is assumed.
855    *  <li class='note'>
856    *    This method automatically calls {@link #cache()} so that the body can be retrieved multiple times.
857    *    <li class='note'>
858    *       The input stream is automatically closed after this call.
859    * </ul>
860    *
861    * @return The response as a string.
862    * @throws RestCallException
863    *    <ul>
864    *       <li>If the input contains a syntax error or is malformed, or is not valid for the specified type.
865    *       <li>If a connection error occurred.
866    *    </ul>
867    */
868   public String asString() throws RestCallException {
869      cache();
870      try (Reader r = asReader()) {
871         return read(r);
872      } catch (IOException e) {
873         response.close();
874         throw new RestCallException(response, e, "Could not read response body.");
875      }
876   }
877
878   /**
879    * Same as {@link #asString()} but allows you to run the call asynchronously.
880    *
881    * <ul class='notes'>
882    *    <li class='note'>
883    *       If no charset was found on the <code>Content-Type</code> response header, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is assumed.
884    *  <li class='note'>
885    *    This method automatically calls {@link #cache()} so that the body can be retrieved multiple times.
886    *    <li class='note'>
887    *       The input stream is automatically closed after this call.
888    * </ul>
889    *
890    * @return The future object.
891    * @throws RestCallException If the executor service was not defined.
892    * @see
893    *    RestClient.Builder#executorService(ExecutorService, boolean) for defining the executor service for creating
894    *    {@link Future Futures}.
895    */
896   public Future<String> asStringFuture() throws RestCallException {
897      return client.getExecutorService().submit(
898         new Callable<String>() {
899            @Override /* Callable */
900            public String call() throws Exception {
901               return asString();
902            }
903         }
904      );
905   }
906
907   /**
908    * Same as {@link #asString()} but truncates the string to the specified length.
909    *
910    * <p>
911    * If truncation occurs, the string will be suffixed with <js>"..."</js>.
912    *
913    * @param length The max length of the returned string.
914    * @return The truncated string.
915    * @throws RestCallException If a problem occurred trying to read from the reader.
916    */
917   public String asAbbreviatedString(int length) throws RestCallException {
918      return StringUtils.abbreviate(asString(), length);
919   }
920
921   /**
922    * Returns the HTTP body content as a simple hexadecimal character string.
923    *
924    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
925    * <p class='bcode'>
926    *    0123456789ABCDEF
927    * </p>
928    *
929    * @return The incoming input from the connection as a plain string.
930    * @throws RestCallException If a problem occurred trying to read from the reader.
931    */
932   public String asHex() throws RestCallException {
933      return toHex(asBytes());
934   }
935
936   /**
937    * Returns the HTTP body content as a simple space-delimited hexadecimal character string.
938    *
939    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
940    * <p class='bcode'>
941    *    01 23 45 67 89 AB CD EF
942    * </p>
943    *
944    * @return The incoming input from the connection as a plain string.
945    * @throws RestCallException If a problem occurred trying to read from the reader.
946    */
947   public String asSpacedHex() throws RestCallException {
948      return toSpacedHex(asBytes());
949   }
950
951   /**
952    * Parses the output from the body into the specified type and then wraps that in a {@link ObjectRest}.
953    *
954    * <p>
955    * Useful if you want to quickly retrieve a single value from inside of a larger JSON document.
956    *
957    * @param innerType The class type of the POJO being wrapped.
958    * @return The parsed output wrapped in a {@link ObjectRest}.
959    * @throws RestCallException
960    *    <ul>
961    *       <li>If the input contains a syntax error or is malformed, or is not valid for the specified type.
962    *       <li>If a connection error occurred.
963    *    </ul>
964    */
965   public ObjectRest asObjectRest(Class<?> innerType) throws RestCallException {
966      return new ObjectRest(as(innerType));
967   }
968
969   /**
970    * Converts the output from the connection into an {@link JsonMap} and then wraps that in a {@link ObjectRest}.
971    *
972    * <p>
973    * Useful if you want to quickly retrieve a single value from inside of a larger JSON document.
974    *
975    * @return The parsed output wrapped in a {@link ObjectRest}.
976    * @throws RestCallException
977    *    <ul>
978    *       <li>If the input contains a syntax error or is malformed, or is not valid for the specified type.
979    *       <li>If a connection error occurred.
980    *    </ul>
981    */
982   public ObjectRest asObjectRest() throws RestCallException {
983      return asObjectRest(JsonMap.class);
984   }
985
986   /**
987    * Converts the contents of the response body to a string and then matches the specified pattern against it.
988    *
989    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
990    * <p class='bjava'>
991    *    <jc>// Parse response using a regular expression.</jc>
992    *    Matcher <jv>matcher</jv> = <jv>client</jv>
993    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
994    *       .run()
995    *       .getContent().asMatcher(Pattern.<jsm>compile</jsm>(<js>"foo=(.*)"</js>));
996    *
997    *    <jk>if</jk> (<jv>matcher</jv>.matches()) {
998    *       String <jv>foo</jv> = <jv>matcher</jv>.group(1);
999    *    }
1000    * </p>
1001    *
1002    * <ul class='notes'>
1003    *    <li class='note'>
1004    *       If no charset was found on the <code>Content-Type</code> response header, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is assumed.
1005    *  <li class='note'>
1006    *    This method automatically calls {@link #cache()} so that the body can be retrieved multiple times.
1007    *    <li class='note'>
1008    *       The input stream is automatically closed after this call.
1009    * </ul>
1010    *
1011    * @param pattern The regular expression pattern to match.
1012    * @return The matcher.
1013    * @throws RestCallException If a connection error occurred.
1014    */
1015   public Matcher asMatcher(Pattern pattern) throws RestCallException {
1016      return pattern.matcher(asString());
1017   }
1018
1019   /**
1020    * Converts the contents of the response body to a string and then matches the specified pattern against it.
1021    *
1022    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1023    * <p class='bjava'>
1024    *    <jc>// Parse response using a regular expression.</jc>
1025    *    Matcher <jv>matcher</jv> = <jv>client</jv>
1026    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1027    *       .run()
1028    *       .getContent().asMatcher(<js>"foo=(.*)"</js>);
1029    *
1030    *    <jk>if</jk> (<jv>matcher</jv>.matches()) {
1031    *       String <jv>foo</jv> = <jv>matcher</jv>.group(1);
1032    *    }
1033    * </p>
1034    *
1035    *
1036    * <ul class='notes'>
1037    *    <li class='note'>
1038    *       If no charset was found on the <code>Content-Type</code> response header, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is assumed.
1039    *  <li class='note'>
1040    *    If {@link #cache()} or {@link RestResponse#cacheContent()} has been called, this method can be can be called multiple times and/or combined with
1041    *    other methods that retrieve the content of the response.  Otherwise a {@link RestCallException}
1042    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} will be thrown.
1043    *    <li class='note'>
1044    *       The input stream is automatically closed after this call.
1045    * </ul>
1046    *
1047    * @param regex The regular expression pattern to match.
1048    * @return The matcher.
1049    * @throws RestCallException If a connection error occurred.
1050    */
1051   public Matcher asMatcher(String regex) throws RestCallException {
1052      return asMatcher(regex, 0);
1053   }
1054
1055   /**
1056    * Converts the contents of the response body to a string and then matches the specified pattern against it.
1057    *
1058    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1059    * <p class='bjava'>
1060    *    <jc>// Parse response using a regular expression.</jc>
1061    *    Matcher <jv>matcher</jv> = <jv>client</jv>
1062    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1063    *       .run()
1064    *       .getContent().asMatcher(<js>"foo=(.*)"</js>, <jsf>MULTILINE</jsf> &amp; <jsf>CASE_INSENSITIVE</jsf>);
1065    *
1066    *    <jk>if</jk> (<jv>matcher</jv>.matches()) {
1067    *       String <jv>foo</jv> = <jv>matcher</jv>.group(1);
1068    *    }
1069    * </p>
1070    *
1071    *
1072    * <ul class='notes'>
1073    *    <li class='note'>
1074    *       If no charset was found on the <code>Content-Type</code> response header, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is assumed.
1075    *  <li class='note'>
1076    *    If {@link #cache()} or {@link RestResponse#cacheContent()} has been called, this method can be can be called multiple times and/or combined with
1077    *    other methods that retrieve the content of the response.  Otherwise a {@link RestCallException}
1078    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} will be thrown.
1079    *    <li class='note'>
1080    *       The input stream is automatically closed after this call.
1081    * </ul>
1082    *
1083    * @param regex The regular expression pattern to match.
1084    * @param flags Pattern match flags.  See {@link Pattern#compile(String, int)}.
1085    * @return The matcher.
1086    * @throws RestCallException If a connection error occurred.
1087    */
1088   public Matcher asMatcher(String regex, int flags) throws RestCallException {
1089      return asMatcher(Pattern.compile(regex, flags));
1090   }
1091
1092   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1093   // Assertions
1094   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1095
1096   /**
1097    * Provides the ability to perform fluent-style assertions on this response body.
1098    *
1099    * <p>
1100    * This method is called directly from the {@link RestResponse#assertContent()} method to instantiate a fluent assertions object.
1101    *
1102    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
1103    * <p class='bjava'>
1104    *    <jc>// Validates the response body equals the text "OK".</jc>
1105    *    <jv>client</jv>
1106    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1107    *       .run()
1108    *       .getContent().assertValue().equals(<js>"OK"</js>);
1109    *
1110    *    <jc>// Validates the response body contains the text "OK".</jc>
1111    *    <jv>client</jv>
1112    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1113    *       .run()
1114    *       .getContent().assertValue().contains(<js>"OK"</js>);
1115    *
1116    *    <jc>// Validates the response body passes a predicate test.</jc>
1117    *    <jv>client</jv>
1118    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1119    *       .run()
1120    *       .getContent().assertValue().is(<jv>x</jv> -&gt; <jv>x</jv>.contains(<js>"OK"</js>));
1121    *
1122    *    <jc>// Validates the response body matches a regular expression.</jc>
1123    *    <jv>client</jv>
1124    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1125    *       .run()
1126    *       .getContent().assertValue().isPattern(<js>".*OK.*"</js>);
1127    *
1128    *    <jc>// Validates the response body matches a regular expression using regex flags.</jc>
1129    *    <jv>client</jv>
1130    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1131    *       .run()
1132    *       .getContent().assertValue().isPattern(<js>".*OK.*"</js>,  <jsf>MULTILINE</jsf> &amp; <jsf>CASE_INSENSITIVE</jsf>);
1133    *
1134    *    <jc>// Validates the response body matches a regular expression in the form of an existing Pattern.</jc>
1135    *    Pattern <jv>pattern</jv> = Pattern.<jsm>compile</jsm>(<js>".*OK.*"</js>);
1136    *    <jv>client</jv>
1137    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1138    *       .run()
1139    *       .getContent().assertValue().isPattern(<jv>pattern</jv>);
1140    * </p>
1141    *
1142    * <p>
1143    * The assertion test returns the original response object allowing you to chain multiple requests like so:
1144    * <p class='bjava'>
1145    *    <jc>// Validates the response body matches a regular expression.</jc>
1146    *    MyBean <jv>bean</jv> = <jv>client</jv>
1147    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1148    *       .run()
1149    *       .getContent().assertValue().isPattern(<js>".*OK.*"</js>);
1150    *       .getContent().assertValue().isNotPattern(<js>".*ERROR.*"</js>)
1151    *       .getContent().as(MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
1152    * </p>
1153    *
1154    * <ul class='notes'>
1155    *    <li class='note'>
1156    *       If no charset was found on the <code>Content-Type</code> response header, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is assumed.
1157    *  <li class='note'>
1158    *    This method automatically calls {@link #cache()} so that the body can be retrieved multiple times.
1159    *    <li class='note'>
1160    *       The input stream is automatically closed after this call.
1161    * </ul>
1162    *
1163    * @return A new fluent assertion object.
1164    */
1165   public FluentResponseBodyAssertion<ResponseContent> assertValue() {
1166      return new FluentResponseBodyAssertion<>(this, this);
1167   }
1168
1169   /**
1170    * Shortcut for calling <c>assertValue().asString()</c>.
1171    *
1172    * @return A new fluent assertion.
1173    */
1174   public FluentStringAssertion<ResponseContent> assertString() {
1175      return new FluentResponseBodyAssertion<>(this, this).asString();
1176   }
1177
1178   /**
1179    * Shortcut for calling <c>assertValue().asBytes()</c>.
1180    *
1181    * @return A new fluent assertion.
1182    */
1183   public FluentByteArrayAssertion<ResponseContent> assertBytes() {
1184      return new FluentResponseBodyAssertion<>(this, this).asBytes();
1185   }
1186
1187   /**
1188    * Shortcut for calling <c>assertValue().as(<jv>type</jv>)</c>.
1189    *
1190    * @param <T> The object type to create.
1191    * @param type The object type to create.
1192    * @return A new fluent assertion.
1193    */
1194   public <T> FluentAnyAssertion<T,ResponseContent> assertObject(Class<T> type) {
1195      return new FluentResponseBodyAssertion<>(this, this).as(type);
1196   }
1197
1198   /**
1199    * Shortcut for calling <c>assertValue().as(<jv>type</jv>, <jv>args</jv>)</c>.
1200    *
1201    * @param <T> The object type to create.
1202    * @param type The object type to create.
1203    * @param args Optional type arguments.
1204    * @return A new fluent assertion.
1205    */
1206   public <T> FluentAnyAssertion<Object,ResponseContent> assertObject(Type type, Type...args) {
1207      return new FluentResponseBodyAssertion<>(this, this).as(type, args);
1208   }
1209
1210   /**
1211    * Returns the response that created this object.
1212    *
1213    * @return The response that created this object.
1214    */
1215   public RestResponse response() {
1216      return response;
1217   }
1218
1219   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1220   // HttpEntity passthrough methods.
1221   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1222
1223   /**
1224    * Tells if the entity is capable of producing its data more than once.
1225    *
1226    * <p>
1227    * A repeatable entity's {@link #getContent()} and {@link #writeTo(OutputStream)} methods can be called more than
1228    * once whereas a non-repeatable entity's can not.
1229    *
1230    * <ul class='notes'>
1231    * <li class='note'>This method always returns <jk>true</jk> if the response body is cached (see {@link #cache()}).
1232    * </ul>
1233    *
1234    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the entity is repeatable, <jk>false</jk> otherwise.
1235    */
1236   @Override /* HttpEntity */
1237   public boolean isRepeatable() {
1238      return cached || entity.isRepeatable();
1239   }
1240
1241   /**
1242    * Tells about chunked encoding for this entity.
1243    *
1244    * <p>
1245    * The primary purpose of this method is to indicate whether chunked encoding should be used when the entity is sent.
1246    * <br>For entities that are received, it can also indicate whether the entity was received with chunked encoding.
1247    *
1248    * <p>
1249    * The behavior of wrapping entities is implementation dependent, but should respect the primary purpose.
1250    *
1251    * @return <jk>true</jk> if chunked encoding is preferred for this entity, or <jk>false</jk> if it is not.
1252    */
1253   @Override /* HttpEntity */
1254   public boolean isChunked() {
1255      return entity.isChunked();
1256   }
1257
1258   /**
1259    * Tells the length of the content, if known.
1260    *
1261    * @return
1262    *    The number of bytes of the content, or a negative number if unknown.
1263    *    <br>If the content length is known but exceeds {@link Long#MAX_VALUE}, a negative number is returned.
1264    */
1265   @Override /* HttpEntity */
1266   public long getContentLength() {
1267      return body != null ? body.length : entity.getContentLength();
1268   }
1269
1270   /**
1271    * Obtains the <c>Content-Type</c> header, if known.
1272    *
1273    * <p>
1274    * This is the header that should be used when sending the entity, or the one that was received with the entity.
1275    * It can include a charset attribute.
1276    *
1277    * @return The <c>Content-Type</c> header for this entity, or <jk>null</jk> if the content type is unknown.
1278    */
1279   @Override /* HttpEntity */
1280   public ResponseHeader getContentType() {
1281      return new ResponseHeader("Content-Type", request, response, entity.getContentType());
1282   }
1283
1284   /**
1285    * Obtains the Content-Encoding header, if known.
1286    *
1287    * <p>
1288    * This is the header that should be used when sending the entity, or the one that was received with the entity.
1289    * <br>Wrapping entities that modify the content encoding should adjust this header accordingly.
1290    *
1291    * @return The <c>Content-Encoding</c> header for this entity, or <jk>null</jk> if the content encoding is unknown.
1292    */
1293   @Override /* HttpEntity */
1294   public ResponseHeader getContentEncoding() {
1295      return new ResponseHeader("Content-Encoding", request, response, entity.getContentEncoding());
1296   }
1297
1298   /**
1299    * Returns a content stream of the entity.
1300    *
1301    * <ul class='notes'>
1302    *    <li class='note'>This method is equivalent to {@link #asInputStream()} which is the preferred method for fluent-style coding.
1303    *    <li class='note'>This input stream will auto-close once the end of stream has been reached.
1304    *    <li class='note'>It is up to the caller to properly close this stream if not fully consumed.
1305    *    <li class='note'>This method can be called multiple times if the entity is repeatable or the cache flag is set on this object.
1306    *    <li class='note'>Calling this method multiple times on a non-repeatable or cached body will throw a {@link IllegalStateException}.
1307    *       Note that this is different from the HttpClient specs for this method.
1308    * </ul>
1309    *
1310    * @return Content stream of the entity.
1311    */
1312   @Override /* HttpEntity */
1313   public InputStream getContent() throws IOException, UnsupportedOperationException {
1314      return asInputStream();
1315   }
1316
1317   /**
1318    * Writes the entity content out to the output stream.
1319    *
1320    * <ul class='notes'>
1321    *    <li class='note'>This method is equivalent to {@link #pipeTo(OutputStream)} which is the preferred method for fluent-style coding.
1322    * </ul>
1323    *
1324    * @param outstream The output stream to write entity content to.
1325    */
1326   @Override /* HttpEntity */
1327   public void writeTo(OutputStream outstream) throws IOException {
1328      pipeTo(outstream);
1329   }
1330
1331   /**
1332    * Tells whether this entity depends on an underlying stream.
1333    *
1334    * <ul class='notes'>
1335    * <li class='note'>This method always returns <jk>false</jk> if the response body is cached (see {@link #cache()}.
1336    * </ul>
1337    *
1338    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the entity content is streamed, <jk>false</jk> otherwise.
1339    */
1340   @Override /* HttpEntity */
1341   public boolean isStreaming() {
1342      return cached ? false : entity.isStreaming();
1343   }
1344
1345   /**
1346    * This method is called to indicate that the content of this entity is no longer required.
1347    *
1348    * <p>
1349    * This method is of particular importance for entities being received from a connection.
1350    * <br>The entity needs to be consumed completely in order to re-use the connection with keep-alive.
1351    *
1352    * @throws IOException If an I/O error occurs.
1353    * @deprecated Use standard java convention to ensure resource deallocation by calling {@link InputStream#close()} on
1354    * the input stream returned by {@link #getContent()}
1355    */
1356   @Override /* HttpEntity */
1357   @Deprecated
1358   public void consumeContent() throws IOException {
1359      entity.consumeContent();
1360   }
1361
1362   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1363   // Utility methods
1364   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1365
1366   private BeanContext getBeanContext() {
1367      return parser == null ? BeanContext.DEFAULT : parser.getBeanContext();
1368   }
1369
1370   private <T> ClassMeta<T> getClassMeta(Class<T> c) {
1371      return getBeanContext().getClassMeta(c);
1372   }
1373
1374   private <T> ClassMeta<T> getClassMeta(Type type, Type...args) {
1375      return getBeanContext().getClassMeta(type, args);
1376   }
1377}
